hints_html: What is the dimension of A? All entries of A are initially zero. Which entries are then changed in line 2 and 3?
hints_latex:
What is the dimension of \emph{A}? All entries of \emph{A} are initially
zero. Which entries are then changed in line 2 and 3?
hints_raw: What is the dimension of ''A''? All entries of ''A'' are initially zero. Which entries are then changed in line 2 and 3?
question: A 12
sols_html:
These commands have the following effects, in sequence:

“A = zeros(2,3);” creates a matrix of zeroes having 2 rows and 3 columns. “A(1,1) = 2;” changes the value in the first row, first column entry to 2. “A(2,3) = 3;” changes the value in the second row, third column entry to 3.

The result is the following matrix, “A”.

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 3\end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
These commands have the following effects, in sequence:

"A = zeros(2,3);" creates a matrix of zeroes having 2 rows and 3
columns. "A(1,1) = 2;" changes the value in the first row, first column
entry to 2. "A(2,3) = 3;" changes the value in the second row, third
column entry to 3.

The result is the following matrix, "A".

\begin{align*}
A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 3\end{array}\right]
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
These commands have the following effects, in sequence:

"<font face="Courier">A = zeros(2,3);</font>" creates a matrix of zeroes having 2 rows and 3 columns. "<font face="Courier">A(1,1) = 2;</font>" changes the value in the first row, first column entry to 2. "<font face="Courier">A(2,3) = 3;</font>" changes the value in the second row, third column entry to 3. 

The result is the following matrix, "<font face="Courier">A</font>".

:<math>
A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 3\end{array}\right]
</math>
statement_html:
Write the matrix A that would result from the following lines of MATLAB code:

A = zeros(2,3);
A(1,1) = 2;
A(2,3) = 3;
statement_raw:
Write the matrix <font face="Courier">A</font> that would result from the following lines of MATLAB code:

<font face="Courier">
A = zeros(2,3);<br>
A(1,1) = 2;<br>
A(2,3) = 3;
</font>
